task: Janek is playing an arcade challenge. In this game, players score points by collecting coins and stars. Each coin is worth $c$ points, and each star is worth $s$ points. The first time Janek played, he collected 28 coins and 7 stars, scoring 777 points. The second time, he collected 31 coins and 9 stars, scoring 909 points. Which system of equations can be used to determine the values of $c$ and $s$?
explanation:
Choice A is correct. Janek played an arcade challenge where points are earned by collecting coins and stars.
Each coin is worth $c$ points, and each star is worth $s$ points. The first time Janek played, he collected 28 coins and 7 stars, scoring 777 points.
The second time, Janek collected 31 coins and 9 stars, scoring 909 points.
Setting up the system of equations, we have:
$ 28c + 7s = 777 $
$ 31c + 9s = 909 $
This forms the correct system of equations.
